title: Data
text: Select population, socioeconomic, housing measures derived 2023 5-yr U.S. Census American Community Survey (ACS) selected cover three domains: Population: number kids, number households (kids), single-parent households, racial ethnic composition, limited English speaking households Socioeconomic: education, income, poverty, employment, health insurance, public income assistance Housing: vacancy, age, value, tenure, rent income ratio

title: Data
text: Measures definitions contained make.R. Generally, derived ACS measures expressed one three ways: measures starting n_ represent number something, n_household measures starting prop_ represent proportion total, prop_poverty measures starting median_ represent median number population, median_income

title: Data
text: Additionally, data summaries may suppressed census bureau.

text: R: Manually: Download csv ⬇️

title: Data
text: Census tract-level measures crime incidents (including property crimes, violent crimes, crimes, gunshots, reported shootings) Hamilton County, Ohio. Tract-level measures derived data packages stored xx_address repository, including crime_incidents-v0.1.2, shotspotter-v0.1.2, reported_shootings-v0.1.0. View metadata data packages information sources.

title: Data
text: Jittered (within block) latitude longitude corresponding location reported crime available data source. text: census tract-level measure drive time Cincinnati Children’s Hospital Medical Center derived using 6-minute interval drive time isochrones obtained openroute service.

title: Data
text: Environmental Justice Index uses data U.S. Census Bureau, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, U.S. Mine Safety Health Administration, U.S. Centers Disease Control Prevention rank cumulative impacts environmental injustice health every census tract. … EJI ranks tract 36 environmental, social, health factors groups three overarching modules ten different domains. ATSDR’s Environmental Justice Index (EJI) recently released 2022, utilizes data several older sources. Note although EJI data year 2022 CoDEC data package, fields EJI different sources actually older. Find full documentation EJI PDF form : https://eji.cdc.gov/Documents/Data/2022/EJI_2022_Data_Dictionary_508.pdf

title: Data
text: Data download https://www.atsdr.cdc.gov/placeandhealth/eji/eji-data-download.html geodatabase Data fields representing “estimates” (.e., “percentile” “summed ranks”) selected avilable elsewhere (e.g., American Community Survey estimates) Field names renamed longer descriptive Although 2022 release, 2010 vintage census tract geographies identifers used EJI data

title: Data
text: R: Manually: Download csv ⬇️

title: Data
text: Taken https://github.com/geomarker-io/hamilton_landcover. Census tract-level measures greenness, imperviousness, treecanopy derived National Land Cover Database (NLCD) NASA MODIS satellite data. Although year=2019 product, compilation annual products unique years denoted field names.

title: Data
text: See https://github.com/geomarker-io/hamilton_landcover data source scripts.

what: Defining greenspace using NLCD land cover classifications

text: grid cell considered greenspace NLCD land cover classification category except water, ice/snow, developed medium intensity, developed high intensity, rock/sand/clay.

previous_headings: Landcover, Built Environment, and Greenness > Data
title: Data
text: Enhanced Vegetation Index (EVI) measure greenness ranges -0.2 1, higher values corresponding vegetation. cloud-free composite EVI raster resolution 250 × 250 m created assembling individual images collected via remote sensing June 10 June 25, 2018.

title: Data
text: R: Manually: Download csv ⬇️

title: Data
text: Census tract-level measures parcel characteristics residential parcles Hamilton County, Ohio. Tract-level measures derived data packages stored parcel repository. Version 0.1.0 parcel CoDEC data resource harmonizes cagis_parcels-v1.1.1 auditor_online_parcels-v0.2.1. View metadata data packages information sources.

title: Data
text: Parcel-level measures aggregated tract level: median: market_total_value, acreage, year_built, number rooms fraction parcels: land use type, homestead flag Parcel land use types grouped general categories: apartments: apartment, 4-19 units, apartment, 20-39 units, apartment, 40+ units, office / apartment assisted housing: metropolitan housing authority, lihtc res condominiums: condominium unit, condo pud garage single family homes: single family dwelling two three family homes: two family dwelling, three family dwelling

title: Data
text: R: Manually: Download csv ⬇️

title: Data
text: Tract-level measures derived property_code_enforcements-v1.0.1 data package stored parcel repository.

title: Data
text: census tract-level number property code enforcements (n_property_code_enforcements) calculated intersecting jittered coordinates enforcements 2020 census tract boundaries totaling per year (2017 - present).

title: Data
text: R: Manually: Download csv ⬇️

title: Data
text: AADT stands Average Anual Daily Traffic. Aggregated census tract-level, AADT measured vehicle-meter counts (aadtm) grouped class (passenger, trucks_buses, tractor_trailer). Data downloaded 2020 Highway Performance Monitoring System (HPMS) geodatabase hosted ESRI using {appc} package R. details HPMS, see: https://www.fhwa.dot.gov/policyinformation/hpms.cfm https://data-usdot.opendata.arcgis.com/datasets/usdot::highway-performance-monitoring-system-hpms-2020/https://www.fhwa.dot.gov/policyinformation/hpms/fieldmanual/hpms_field_manual_dec2016.pdf

title: Data
text: roads F_SYSTEM classification 1 (“interstate”) 2 (“principal arterial - freeways expressways”) used. Passenger vehicles (FHWA 1-3) calculated total minus FHWA class 4-7 (single unit) 8-13 (combo). 2020 census tract geography, sum class-specific AADT intersecting roads, weighted intersecting lengths.

title: Data
text: R: Manually: Download csv ⬇️

title: Data Harmonization
text: Data people sharing data, privacy spectrum tradeoffs risks benefits individuals populations. Data collected individual-level one organization often shared another organization due legal restrictions organization-specific data governance policies. often interested community-level (e.g. neighborhood, census tract, ZIP code) data disaggregated gender, race, sensitive attributes. Achieving data harmonization upstream storage allows contribution disaggregated, community-level data without disclosing individual-level data sharing across organizations.

title: Data Harmonization
text: Like namesake, CoDEC encodes data streams communities live common format using census tract month can decoded different community-level geographies different time frames. CoDEC relies cincy R package define Cincinnati-area geographies interpolate area-level data census tracts, neighborhoods, ZIP codes different years.  Specifications defined checked using as_codec_dpkg() function R.

title: Data Harmonization
text: White House’s Equitable Data Working Group defined equitable data “allow rigorous assessment extent government programs policies yield consistently fair, just, impartial treatment individuals.” advise equitable data “illuminate opportunities targeted actions result demonstrably improved outcomes underserved communities.” group recommended make disaggregated data norm “… intentional data collected shared, well data protected exacerbate vulnerability members underserved communities, many face heightened risk harm privacy protected.” U.S. Chief Data Scientist, Denice Ross, declared “open data necessary sufficient drive type action need create equitable society.” Open data can fall short driving action equitable. Disaggregating data sensitive attributes, like race ethnicity, can elucidate inequities otherwise remain hidden.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Cole Brokamp. Author, maintainer. Erika Manning. Author. Andrew Vancil. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brokamp C, Manning E, Vancil (2025). codec: Community Data Explorer Cincinnati. R package version 3.0.0, https://geomarker.io/codec.
code: @Manual{,   title = {codec: Community Data Explorer for Cincinnati},   author = {Cole Brokamp and Erika Manning and Andrew Vancil},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 3.0.0},   url = {https://geomarker.io/codec}, }

title: Community Data Explorer for Cincinnati
text: Community Data Explorer Cincinnati (CoDEC) data repository composed equitable, community-level data Cincinnati. Data communities live come different spatiotemporal resolutions extents often designed specific goal integrating data. CoDEC defines specifications community-level data effort make FAIR. Operating common data specification means organizations can easily use methods tools harmonizing, storing, accessing, sharing community-level data. data can described, curated, checked CoDEC specifications using codec R package. Using tools, collection extant community-level data resources automatically transformed harmonized, community-level data package openly available accompanied (1) richly-documented data catalog, (2) web-based interface exploring learning data, (3) API accessing data scale demand.  Data packages created transparently reproducibly using code assemble data automatically validate data structures. single point data consumption provides ownership process harmonizing data integrates well data governance, importantly, can provide data consumed multiple ways (e.g., dashboard, tabular data file, API). Creating maintaining open community-level data resource equips entire community data-powered decision making boosts organizational trustworthiness. Demonstrating reliability capability appropriately managing shared data helps earn trust organizations communities intended served.

what: Convert a data frame, name, and description into a CoDEC table — as_codec_tbl
title: Convert a data frame, name, and description into a CoDEC table — as_codec_tbl
text: CoDEC Specifications: data must include census tract identifier column (.e., census_tract_id_2010, census_tract_id_2020). column must contain 11-digit GEOID identifiers every census tract Hamilton County, OH. Data must structured tidy format row observation specific census tract specific year (month). means data includes year column (year), integer year representing vintage data (e.g. 2021). data can optionally include month column (month), integer month year. name must contain lower case alphanumeric characters, -, _ description markdown text first line must contain title CoDEC data table level one header (e.g., # Community Data). Titles must less 80 characters.

title: Convert a data frame, name, and description into a CoDEC table — as_codec_tbl
Convert a data frame, name, and description into a CoDEC table — as_codec_tbl
text: x data.frame tibble meeting CoDEC data specifications name name CoDEC table description markdown text describing CoDEC table

title: Convert a data frame, name, and description into a CoDEC table — as_codec_tbl
text: codec_tbl object

title: Convert a data frame, name, and description into a CoDEC table — as_codec_tbl
code: tibble::tibble(   census_tract_id_2020 = cincy_census_geo("tract", "2020")$geoid,   n_things = 823,   year = 2024L ) |>   as_codec_tbl(     name = "n_things",     "# Number of Things\n Number of things were averaged by census tract using the survey from 2024"   ) #> # A tibble: 226 × 3 #>    census_tract_id_2020 n_things  year #>    <chr>                   <dbl> <int> #>  1 39061005200               823  2024 #>  2 39061026200               823  2024 #>  3 39061023901               823  2024 #>  4 39061023701               823  2024 #>  5 39061010500               823  2024 #>  6 39061020501               823  2024 #>  7 39061021900               823  2024 #>  8 39061021102               823  2024 #>  9 39061003700               823  2024 #> 10 39061003800               823  2024 #> # ℹ 216 more rows

title: Cincy address geographies — cincy_addr_geo
text: CAGIS data (see install_cagis_data()) provides list addresses Hamilton County. Addresses filtered following criteria: use addresses STATUS ASSIGNED, USING, REGISTERED orphaned (ORPHANFLG == "N") omit addresses ADDRTYPEs milemarkers (MM), parks (PAR), infrastructure projects (PRJ), cell towers (CTW), vacant commercial lots (LOT), miscellaneous non-residential addresses (MIS, RR, TBA) s2 cell derived LONGITUDE LATITUDE fields CAGIS address database

title: Cincy address geographies — cincy_addr_geo
text: packaged logical; use data included package instead ()loading source data?

title: Cincy address geographies — cincy_addr_geo

About the CoDEC package — codec-package
text: CoDEC data package specifications provide set patterns designed make sharing tabular community-level data easier. Examples type data include pediatric hospitalization rate per month per census tract, total number gunshots per season per neighborhood, housing code enforcement density per year per ZIP code. Data specified average values total counts census tract geographies specific year (year month). required census tract identifer year (year month) columns CoDEC table contain spatiotemporal information can used link data.

title: About the CoDEC package — codec-package
text: Maintainer: Cole Brokamp cole.brokamp@gmail.com Authors: Erika Manning Andrew Vancil

title: Spatially interpolate community-level data — codec_interpolate
text: CoDEC data package simple features object returned one cincy_*_geo() functions (.e., cincy_census_geo(), cincy_neighborhood_geo(), cincy_zcta_geo()`) weights census block-level weights use; see details

title: Spatially interpolate community-level data — codec_interpolate
text: tibble new geographic identifier column target geography (geoid) addition (interpolated) columns

title: Spatially interpolate community-level data — codec_interpolate
text: Block-level total population (pop), total number homes (homes), total land area (area) 2020 Census can chosen use weights. Geospatial intersection happens transforming geographies epsg:5072. See codec_as_sf() adding geography CoDEC data package. Variables beginning "n_" interpolated using weighted sum; variables interpolated using weighted mean.

title: CoDEC latest annual — codec_latest_annual
text: CoDEC data harmonized recently available annual (annual average monthly) values census tract 2020 geography. year represents year table assembled mainly used placeholder object can used functions take codec_tbl object (see ?as_codec_tbl). See description metadata actual latest years used CoDEC table.

title: CoDEC latest annual — codec_latest_annual
text: object class codec_tbl (inherits tbl_df, tbl, data.frame) 226 rows 66 columns.

title: CoDEC latest annual — codec_latest_annual

census tract 2020 geography. #> The year represents the year this table was assembled and mainly used as a placeholder so this object can be used with codec_*() functions. #> The actual latest years title: CoDEC online data catalog — codec_read
text: CoDEC online data catalog hosted GitHub alongside source code package. Use codec_read() shortcut read CoDEC table R codec_tbl object (see ?as_codec_tbl) Use codec_list() shortcut list available CoDEC table pins codec_board() can used create pin board object (see ?pins::pins) based specific version codec package

title: CoDEC online data catalog — codec_read
code: codec_read(name, board = codec_board())  codec_list(board = codec_board())  codec_board(   version = paste0("v", utils::packageVersion("codec")),   cache = NULL,   use_cache_on_failure = rlang::is_interactive(),   headers = NULL )

title: CoDEC online data catalog — codec_read
text: name name CoDEC table online CoDEC data catalog. board pins board object; create codec_board() read earlier versions catalog change caching behavior pins package version specify version online data catalog using commit SHA, tag, branch geomarker-io/codec; syncs version installed package default cache Cache path. Every board requires local cache avoid downloading files multiple times. default stores standard cache location operating system, can override needed. use_cache_on_failure pin fails download, ok use last cached version? Defaults is_interactive() robust poor internet connectivity exploring interactively, get clear errors code deployed. headers Named character vector additional HTTP headers (authentication). See connect_auth_headers() Posit Connect support.

title: CoDEC online data catalog — codec_read
text: codec_read(), codec_tbl object (see as_codec_tbl()) codec_list(), character vector CoDEC table names codec_board(), pins_board object

title: CoDEC online data catalog — codec_read
text: pin CoDEC table versions (see ?pins::pin_versions), codec_board() can used specify state online data catalog based version codec package. (See examples)

title: CoDEC online data catalog — codec_read
code: # list available CoDEC tables codec_list() #> [1] "acs_measures"                "crime"                       #> [3] "drivetime"                   "environmental_justice_index" #> [5] "landcover"                   "parcel"                      #> [7] "property_code_enforcements"  "traffic"                      # read a CoDEC table and inspect its metadata d <- codec_read("traffic") head(d) #> # A tibble: 6 × 5 #>   census_tract_id_2020 aadtm_trucks_buses aadtm_tractor_trailer aadtm_passenger #>   <chr>                             <dbl>                 <dbl>           <dbl> #> 1 39061005200                          0                     0               0  #> 2 39061026200                   53551460.            207033030.     1108175821. #> 3 39061023901                   27090895.             39769940.      621615559. #> 4 39061023701                          0                     0               0  #> 5 39061010500                          0                     0               0  #> 6 39061020501                   23210991.             50060424.      556823936. #> # ℹ 1 more variable: year <int> attr(d, "title") #> [1] "Average Annual Vehicle-Meters Driven" message(attr(d, "description")) #> # Average Annual Vehicle-Meters Driven #>  #> ## About #>  #> AADT stands for **A**verage **A**nual **D**aily **T**raffic. #> Aggregated at the census tract-level, AADT is measured in vehicle-meter counts (`aadtm`) and grouped by class (`passenger`, `trucks_buses`, `tractor_trailer`). #>  #> Data is downloaded from the 2020 Highway Performance Monitoring System (HPMS) geodatabase hosted by ESRI using the {[appc](https://github.com/geomarker-io/appc)} package for R. #> For more details about the HPMS, see: #>  #> - <https://www.fhwa.dot.gov/policyinformation/hpms.cfm> #> - <https://data-usdot.opendata.arcgis.com/datasets/usdot::highway-performance-monitoring-system-hpms-2020/about> #> - <https://www.fhwa.dot.gov/policyinformation/hpms/fieldmanual/hpms_field_manual_dec2016.pdf> #>  #> ## Data #>  #> Only roads with `F_SYSTEM` classification of 1 ("interstate") or 2 ("principal arterial - other freeways and expressways") are used. #> Passenger vehicles (FHWA 1-3) are calculated as the total minus FHWA class 4-7 (single unit) and 8-13 (combo). #>  #> For each 2020 census tract geography, sum the class-specific AADT for all intersecting roads, weighted by their intersecting lengths.  # change the defaults for codec_board() to read from older versions of the board codec_board() |>   pins::pin_versions("crime") #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #>   version                created             hash  #>   <chr>                  <dttm>              <chr> #> 1 20250829T181659Z-bf502 2025-08-29 18:16:59 bf502 #> 2 20250831T023010Z-bf502 2025-08-31 02:30:10 bf502 #> 3 20250901T033049Z-bf502 2025-09-01 03:30:49 bf502 #> 4 20250902T005725Z-bf502 2025-09-02 00:57:25 bf502 #> 5 20250902T182616Z-91afb 2025-09-02 18:26:16 91afb codec_board("v3.0.0-rc1") |>   pins::pin_versions("crime") #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   version                created             hash  #>   <chr>                  <dttm>              <chr> #> 1 20250829T181659Z-bf502 2025-08-29 18:16:59 bf502 #> 2 20250831T023010Z-bf502 2025-08-31 02:30:10 bf502 #> 3 20250901T033049Z-bf502 2025-09-01 03:30:49 bf502 #> 4 20250902T005725Z-bf502 2025-09-02 00:57:25 bf502

title: Install CAGIS GIS database — install_cagis_data
text: installs CAGIS Open Data GIS database (.gdb) data directory codec package. downloaded, reused across R sessions computer. geodatabase contains many layers updated quarterly. (Historical geodatabases available .)

title: Install CAGIS GIS database — install_cagis_data
text: cagis_data_url url CAGIS Open Data .gdb.zip file; changes quarterly, check something recent file found
